address.street: Charge Pond, Myles Standish State Forest

title: Myles Standish State Forest Road Race
Massasoit Lung Challenge
description: Sunday, April 28, 2013. The return of the Massasoit Lung Challenge Mountain Bike Race from the 1990’s was a long time coming but is now back for the 3rd year as a fundraiser for the American Lung Association. The traditional spring race works well with the sand based soil of cranberry land and has a tendency to dry out much quicker than other parts of New England.
course: The 7.1 mile course is a large clockwise loop with lots of fun single track, some fast double track and a very limited amount of smooth pavement. The terrain is most difficult in the early part of the loop before becoming more rolling in the middle with a couple of short kickers at the end.
registration: On line Registration ($25) is available on BikeReg.com. Day of registration will be located near the gatehouse on the paved road entering the Park. Day of registration fee add $10.
notes: It\'s a great course rain OR shine. Pre-rides before race day encouraged.
directions:
Massasoit State Park 1361 Middleboro Ave. East Taunton, MA 02718.
 
From Route 24 in Raynham take exit 13 to Route 44 East. Go 2.7 miles and turn right (just after Gas Station) on Richmond St. Go 1.2 miles and turn right on Middleboro Ave. Massasoit will be on your left in .3 miles. 
From Route 495 in Middleboro take exit 5 to Route 18 South. Go .5 miles and turn right (sign for camping) on Taunton Ave. (becomes Middleboro Ave.) Go 2 miles and Massasoit will be on your left.

title: Private My First Road Bike Camp
Blue Hills Classic
description: 7.2mi rolling loop in the Blue Hills Reservation with hilltop finish and camera at the line. Good road surface and rolling closures. Yellow line rule will be strictly enforced. CAT 5 medals (1-3rd). CAT 3, 4 & Masters prizes paid 5 deep ($150,$125,$100,$75,$50) Registration, Staging, Awards, and Start will be at Houghton\'s Pond Parking facility. Course map & race flyer: http://www.bluehillsclassic.com
directions: Directions to Houghton\'s Pond From Rte. 128 take exit 2 (Rte 138N/Milton) •Take right on Blue Hill River Road •@ stop sign go straight onto Hillside Street •Houghton\'s Pond facility will be on your right

title: The Christina Clarke Genco Mother's Day Memori
Tour d'Essex County
directions:
From the South:

Take route 128 North  toward GLOUCESTER/ROCKPORT. 
Take the PINE ST. exit- exit number 16- toward MANCHESTER/MAGNOLIA. 
Turn LEFT onto PINE ST. 
Go down Pine Street approx 1.3 miles to the end.
there will be a gas station on your right. 
Turn LEFT onto CENTRAL ST/ Route 127 
We are on Elm street which will come up quick on 
your left.  If you pass the town hall you
have gone too far. Elm street is a short dead end street.
We are down on the right.



From Cape Ann (Rockport, Gloucester):

Take route 128 south to exit 15. School St. Essex/ Manchester exit.
Stop at top of ramp and go left.
You will come to a four way stop.
go straight to the end. 
at the end take a right onto
Route 127 / Central Street
The town hall should now be on your left. 
As you go by Town Hall you should start to see 
our sign on the right. Go down Elm Street. We are 
right there.

From the North (N.H, ME, Newburyport etc.)

Just head down 95 S. to 128 North. toward Gloucester Rockport
 Take the PINE ST. exit- exit number 16- toward MANCHESTER/MAGNOLIA. 
 Turn LEFT onto PINE ST. 
 Go down Pine Street approx 1.3 miles to the end.
 there will be a gas station on your right.

From the Manchester T stop:

Get off the train and look across the street to the Richdale.  Head towards the Richdale and proceed up the hill.    The road turns sharp left with the book store on your left and the Jewelry shop on your right. Keep going past them toward an intersection after the library.  Pass in front of the Landing restauraunt on your right with the Town Hall on your left. 25 yards past that is Elm street on the right with our sign at the end.  We are just down the street.   It is a 5 minute walk.

title: ECV Time Trial Series
course: You are responsible for knowing the course. There are markings but no marshals.
notes:
Entry fee $10. ECV members $8.

NOTE: we STRONGLY recommend you fill out and sign the release form ahead of time and bring it with you on race day. See the bottom of this page for a link to the PDF release form. One day race license application form is here.

End of year raffle in September. Every race automatically enters you. Prizes include schwag from ECV partners. 

Categories: Junior, Women, Senior, 35+, 45+, 55+

Field limit of 50 riders for every race.
LOCATION: Start is at Hamilton/Wenham High School on Route 1A North. General directions:

Exit 20 off route 128 (take 128 towards Goucester)
Take Route 1A north; about 5 miles on the right is the high school.
Registration begins at 5:00pm at the school. Registration closes at 5:45 SHARP - no exceptions.

First rider goes off at 6:00pm, the rest at 30 second intervals.

USA CYCLING RACE PERMIT PENDING: RIDERS MUST ABIDE BY USCF RULES: ANSI OR SNELL HELMET, CYCLING SHORTS MID THIGH, AND JERSEY THAT COVERS THE SHOULDERS.

Results posted back at the High School on completion of the race. PLEASE WAIT FOR RESULTS AT THE HIGH SCHOOL AND NOT AT THE FINISH.
directions:
Exit 20 off route 128 (take 128 towards Goucester)
Take Route 1A north; about 5 miles on the right is the high school.

title: The Best Buddies Challenge - Hyannisport
description:
Best Buddies Challenge - Hyannisport
A 100, 50 and 20 mile fund raising ride to benefit Best Buddies International
course: There are 3 routes: 100 mile ride starting in Boston, MA; 50 mile ride starting in Carver, MA; 20 mile ride starting in Sandwich, MA
directions: To the 100 mile start take I93 to Boston to Morrissey Blvd, follow signs to JFK Library. To the 50 mile start take RT3 south to RT 44 Plymouth, tkae RT44 west to RT58 take left off exit to start at CVS. To the 20 mile start, take RT6, exit 1, take right off exit to Sandwich, take left onto Merchant Row, CVS

title: Ride Noho My First Road Bike Camp
CYCLE Kids Breakaway
description:
The CYCLE Kids Breakaway Charity ride begins and ends at the beautifully landscaped, wooded grounds of the deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln, MA.  Participants choose from a challenging 63-mile metric century ride that climbs over 3,500 feet, a 36-mile route meandering through beautiful farmlands, a 20-mile ride, or a fun 5-mile family ride that includes a stop at Codman Farm in Lincoln, MA.  

Upon arrival, riders can enjoy delectable breakfast items.  A relaxing post-ride celebration will await riders, including a gourmet luncheon, live bluegrass music, lawn games, and complimentary massages.

title: Ride Noho My First Road Bike Camp
15th Annual NCC Tour of the Hilltowns
Fidelity Investments Gran Prix of Beverly
description:
Fidelity Investments Gran Prix of Beverly 
State Criterium Championships in downtown Beverly, MA
Hosted by Essex County Velo
USAC Permit pending 
$10 day of race fee.
On line service fee applied based on Bikereg.com standard service fee rates

for more info granprixbeverly.com
Registration: At the Beverly Common. Registration opens at 3:00pm closes 30 minutes prior to your race.

Beverly YMCA located at 245 Cabot Street  is allowing use of their changing rooms and showers.  
Race Primes
Several hundred dollars and merchandise are up for grabs in primes. The race announcer will call the primes in each race. 
Race Results
Thanks to John Frey at Velocity Results. Check out velocityresults.net after the event for results.

Kids Parade: Free to all kids 5-12 years old. Kids get to ride on the same course as the adults. Held between the Women & Men\'s events at 6:00pm. 
Kids Registration: Registration is required for all children taking part in either the parade. Registration runs from 4:15-4:45pm on Beverly Common.
Awards Ceremony, Cat 4 Men: Immediately after your race, the top 3 riders should report to the announcers\' stand near the Start/Finish for awards ceremony and to collect their prizes. The podium ceremony will take place at approximately 5:25pm. Prizes outside the top 3 can be collected shortly after the race is over. A race volunteer will be on hand near the Start/Finish line.
Awards Ceremony, Masters: Immediately after the Elite Race, the top 3 riders should report to the announcers\' stand near the Start/Finish for awards ceremony and to collect their prizes. Prizes outside the top 3 can be collected shortly after the race is over. A race volunteer will be on hand near the Start/Finish line.
Awards Ceremony, Women & Elite Men: The State Championship awards ceremony takes place near the finish line at 7:50pm. Awards for the following will be given out:
Top Three finishers
Senior Men age 23-29
U-23 Men age 19-22 
Women
Immediately after the elite Men\'s race, the top riders should report to the announcers\' stand near the Start/Finish for awards ceremony and to collect their prizes. At the completion of the race, announcers will call out the names.  Top 3 riders should be present to collect their prizes. 
Prizes outside the top 3 can be collected shortly after the race is over. A race volunteer will be on hand near the Start/Finish line.
registration: At the Beverly Common. Registration opens at 3:00pm closes 30 minutes prior to your race.
notes:

directions:
DIRECTIONS: 
• Take Route 128 to exit 18 Route 22 South (Essex Street) 
• Take a left turn onto Bisson Street
• Parking is just ahead on Bisson Street and Buttman St.
• Registration is held at the Beverly YMCA on 245 Cabot Street.
• The course is just a few yards away at Beverly Common and Downtown - follow the signs!
http://www.granprixbeverly.com/racerinfo.html

title: Dirty Thirty
description: Dirt road ramble on Nantucket's back roads.  Sandy double-track across gently rolling terrain.
course: Aprox. 30 miles with both fast hard pack and soft sandy sections to navigate.
registration: Register on line or take your chances on race day.  Limit of 75 spots.
directions: Check in and mandatory pre-race briefing at 7:00 AM at the corner of Madaket road and Clark's cove.  NO PARKING ON SITE OR ON COURSE!!!!

title: 18th Annual Hodges Village Dam MTB Race
Cyclocross Camp with Tim Johnson & Pete Webber

address.street: Herter Park, 1155 Soldiers Field Rd, Boston, MA

title: QuadCross 2013
description: Cyclocross Race at the Maynard Rod and Gun club
course: Start off in the grass field, up the hill, through the sand pit, off into the woods on the gravel road, back from the woods on the logging road, back into the grass field, over the barriers, do it again.
directions: From Rt 128 take Rt 2 west 6 miles. Turn left onto MA 62 west.  Follow MA 62 for 4.2 miles. Turn left onto Waltham St. Follow Waltham St .5 miles. Look for the Maynard Rod and Gun Club sign on the left.

title: Honey One Hundred
description: The Honey One Hundred is a 100km Cyclocross adventure/fun ride
course: 100km of mixed terrain. 66% off road, 34% on road, breakfast, lunch and post ride meal included
notes: A mixed terrain adventure ride on cyclocross bikes
directions: Start and finish at the Ride Studio Cafe in Lexington, MA

title: Freetown 50
course: Mixed terrain throughout Southeastern Massachusetts Bioreserve
registration: Online registration open through Friday, September 13 at 6pm.

title: Bike Fest 2013 Tour of the Valley
description: Tour of the Valley entrance fee includes fully supported ride with SAG, rest stop food, a post-ride gourmet BBQ lunch buffet with local craft beers, entertainment featuring the music  of The Art Steele Band, a pro BMX stunt show from Team East and other surprises.  High quality, advertising-free T-Shirts are available for purchase while supplies last $15.
course: There are 5 fantastic ride routes guaranteed to suit riders of all ability levels including an all new 8-mile family ride route with much less climbing.
registration:
Registration limit is 600.  Last year’s event sold out!  Register now.  You will not want to miss BikeFest ’13!
https://www.bikereg.com/Net/19380
directions: Dow Pavillion, Look Park, Northampton, MA - park charges a $7 fee per car, bikes enter for FREE!

title: Big Elm Brewery Cyclocross Challenge
description:
Team Berkshire Bike and Board Cycle Cross Challenge
Saturday September 28, 2013
At Ski Butternut - Great Barrington, MA
Presented by the Berkshire Bike and Board Cycling Team
course:
A fast and technical course on cut grass, pavement,
dirt, and gravel, with dismounts
and run-ups.
registration: Race day registration begins at 8:30 and ends 30 minutes before each race. Register online at BikeReg.com
notes: All USA Cycling rules apply. USA Cycling license required. Race day licenses available for $10. Approved helmets required. No warming up on course during races.

title: POC Intense Eastern States Cup DH#11 Massachusettes State Championship
The Plymouth Festival of Cyclo Cross
Boston Road Club Shedd Park Cyclocross Race
